content:
Wukong stood in front of the magic barrier, looking at MK with his arms crossed. "So you really don't know where the diamond snare is?" he asked.

"I swear I don't," MK replied, his voice hoarse from days of screaming and pleading.

Wukong paced back and forth, thinking aloud. "I need that snare, but you're useless to me if you don't know where it is. Why should I keep you alive?"

MK tried to think of a convincing argument. "You said you needed insurance, right? I can be your insurance. If you let me go, I promise not to tell anyone what you're looking for or what you've done. And if you ever need me again, you can come find me."

Wukong raised an eyebrow. "And why would I trust you?"

MK swallowed hard. "Because... because I admire you. You're a legend. And I promise I won't let you down."

Wukong considered this for a moment, then sighed. "Fine. I'll let you live. For now. But don't try to run away again or I'll kill you myself."

MK let out a small sigh of relief as Wukong turned to leave. "Thank you," he whispered to himself. He knew he still had a long way to go before he could escape, but at least he was alive for now.
